Texts.Chs: <译文: 首先，他们不相信我关于^red;<未知>^reset;的说辞。然后他们说我疯了，竟然认为这样的生物会存在。现在他们就在^red;<未知>^reset;我告诉他们要避免去的地方。事实上是两次。然而，我坐在这间牢房里，等待着因为^red;<未知>^reset;的谎言而死去,，而他们却在调查那些他们和说的不可能存在于这个现实中的东西。
Texts.Eng: <Translation: First, they did not believe me about ^red;<unknown>^reset;. Then they said I was crazy to even think such a creature could exist. And now they are ^red;<unknown>^reset; right where I told them to avoid. Twice, in fact. Yet here I sit in this cell, awaiting my death due to ^red;<unknown>^reset; lies

Texts.Chs: 科学并非意味着知晓一切。此刻，我们自己的狂妄永远吞噬着我们。如果我的任何人读到这个，寻找我们祖先创造的机动世界，加入那里然后开跑。不要对抗！他们会消灭我们的！霸权是错误的，证据就摆在他们面前！>
Texts.Eng: is not meant to know all things. And now our own hubris consumes us forever. If any of my people read this, seek out the cybernetic worlds our forebears created, and join there to flee. Do not fight! They will wipe us out! The Hegemony is wrong, and the proof is staring them in the face!>

Texts.Chs: red;<未知>^reset;的霸权！他们是谎言和欺骗之父。现在他们用贪婪毁灭了我们的人民。在某种程度上，我认为把我们的鼻子伸到不该伸的地方是应受之罪。
Texts.Eng: while they investigate the very thing that I was told could not exist in this reality. ^red;<unknown>^reset; the Hegemony! They are fathers of lies, and of deceptions. And now they have doomed our people in their greed. In a way, I suppose it is poetic justice for sticking our nose where it doesn't belong. Science
